website_summaries.verdict: This lacquer-style clear coat is good for small jobs. It's thinner than other brands, though, and you'll need your own sprayer.
pros: Easy to apply with no re-coat window
cons: Clear coat is thin compared to other brands
You will need to use your own sprayer

customer_reviews.title: Solid paint
customer_reviews.text: Paint went on pretty good and was easy to work with. I was frustrated that I couldn’t find a picture of the midnight blue so I uploaded a picture of mine. I would use again and recommend. I used 5 quarts of paint and 3 quarts of clear coat. 4 quarts of paint would do it if you don’t have a lot to cover up.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Pros + cons ... Great color
customer_reviews.text: It is a lot thinner than any other car paint I've used. The good thing is you don't need to add lacquer thinner so you can spray it straight out of the can. The downside for me was I was unable to use it as a marble effect via hydro dip; it was just too thin. I ended up just using this as the base coat, and the color turned out great. The consistency is like thin chocolate milk.
customer_reviews.author: Tombox

customer_reviews.title: Great for Patina
customer_reviews.text: Have a 1942 1.5 ton truck with original paint with lots of Patina that I wanted to seal and keep this way. This product went on really nice with a HVLP gun. Its very thin lacquer so multiple coats were needed but it went on perfectly. Dyes quickly and really made the patina stand out much more than it was. The orange from the rust really popped out which I wanted and the door logo colors jumped out perfectly. Great product. Very Pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg E

customer_reviews.title: True yellow
customer_reviews.text: Finally was able to get this awesome yellow from Amazon instead of somewhere else..it's beautiful and I get so many compliments on it. It goes on smoothly with my paint sprayer ,looks completely professional. It's also looks super paired with the Metallic Midnight Blue on my boat. This is the only brand I trust.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi Rarick

customer_reviews.title: The better you prep the surface the better the results
customer_reviews.text: I painted the cab, hood,doors and fenders of an old dodge pickup truck used 2 quarts of primer and 2quarts paint.If I knew it was going to turn out so well I would of prep it better.Fast and easy beats buying all those cans of spray paint.
customer_reviews.author: Trish O'Halloran

customer_reviews.title: brilliant silver along with gloss and matte clear coat
customer_reviews.text: This will be my approx. my eighth purchase of this product. I've shot performance red, championship white, mineral grey, jet black, brilliant silver along with gloss and matte clear coat. I cant find any faults with the product other than limited color availability The paint isn't thin it's exactly the correct viscosity it should be. If you use 7 quarts to paint a small car you need to buy an hvlp gun. I shot all these with a Sico mp500 hvlp at 20 lbs and the results are great. If you don't have to match a factory color I highly recommend these paints for ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: brodie

customer_reviews.title: Championship White good for Crown Vic police cars
customer_reviews.text: I got the "Championship White" color for a 2010 Ford Crown Victoria P7B with "performance aka peelformance white" paint. The Championship White is close enough that you can't really tell that it's not the "factory" color. One 32oz can was enough to put 2 good coats each on the roof and trunk. I then put clear over the top of it. It came out looking really nice. We will see how long it lasts. Video will be up on WJ Handy Dad Youtube channel if you want to watch a DIY amateur plug the holes left from the police department and paint their car.
customer_reviews.author: WJ Handy Dad

customer_reviews.title: Good for an amateur
customer_reviews.text: I don't spray much auto paint. This is the first auto paint I've used in 30 years, which is why I went back to lacquer instead of one of the modern paints. It's nice that they send the paint pre-thinned, but if I was an actual knowledgeable person about such things, I'd probably laugh and call it a rip-off. The paint was as expected and came out very nice. You can see from the picture the results. Not the car, the hardtop, which I had just finished building. This is a no-polish, just sprayed look. Pretty smooth considering I have no idea what I am doing.
customer_reviews.author: EastMemphis

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Excessive damage.
customer_reviews.text: Product is awesome but when you buy $450 worth of product and amazon throws 10 cans in a box with only 2 of them being wrapped and the rest dented and two of them leaking. Kinda make you angry that you decided to get a good deal instead of ordering it from a store for $10 more a can. Won’t be ordering anything of this sort from amazon again. Pictures are as pull from box how they shipped it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan & Sam

customer_reviews.title: Just pour in and spray! W/a little prep of course.
customer_reviews.text: Always loved the way Dupli-color laid on and it's rich color and the spray tip on the can so unique I save them for those other cheap cans when I have to use them to save in tight budget days which is another story of my life and too sad to mention so back to the paint it sprays out of my Binks HVLP gun so good right out of the can I can only say it's even better than their best in the business spray cans and I could hardly believe that I could paint that good on my first try with a spray gun on my first vehicle. Look out I might paint it.
customer_reviews.author: Redford G.

customer_reviews.title: The matallic was perfect
customer_reviews.text: By far the best priced paint for the results can’t complain but it needs a clear coat to get a glossy look you can use the rustolum lacquer clear and it worked perfect
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Wow looking sweet
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed using $9.99 hvlp purple gun I call her the Purple People eater lol from Harbor Freight. First time ever spraying a gun in my life. Went with 2 coats primer then 2 coats silver metallic then 2 coats of the blue followed by what's in pics is only 1st coat of clear. Will be laying 2 possibly 3 more down on it. I know its not a car but its parts for Akai MPC'S that I'm customizing. So far I'm thrilled with results the paint is superb. Oh the red is Candy Ruby Red I also ordered off Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Moore

customer_reviews.title: Skip this
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this. Can arrived dented and with a little bit of moisture around the lid. Looked good for a bit until I realized this isn't a "real" clear coat. It doesnt cure right and will have a soft texture a month after curing.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago Cazares

customer_reviews.title: What can I say, it’s so so...
customer_reviews.text: Mixed reviews on this one. It’s great for a beginner because you can spray right out of the can but the clear doesn’t seem as good as a two part system.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mann

customer_reviews.title: Does Exactly What It Should (Just Thin It!)
customer_reviews.text: Just as a warning when you go to use this stuff, make sure you do not spray it right on the panel. You must thin this paint. I never got an exact value, but I think I remember the best results coming from a 4:1 (1/5) mixture. In any case when you shoot with a lacquer make sure you’re using a 1.8mm or 1.7mm gun. The thinner the paint the smaller you’ll get away with but the less protection you’ll have. Thin using a little bit of paint thinner, but if all you have is a stronger solvent go ahead and toss it in the mixture, just be sure not store that newly mixed paint in plastic. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: KMACK

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This can is half the price of the spraypaint version and much more effective. Using an electric sprayer, I applied it to my hood and it went on clean and smooth, plus a little went a long way. The color (which was an exact match) stayed uniform through multiple consecutive coats, which dried quickly and were easy to sand and polish. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Eerie.Brilliance

customer_reviews.title: NO TOUCH UP FOR FUTURE
customer_reviews.text: This product was amazing, it truly was. The color is exactly what I was looking for. However the part I didnt know about was they only sell this color in the quart size. So, for example something on the highway came up and hit and scratched the car. I have to go buy an entire quart of paint instead of a spray can or a touch up pen like they have of other peoples paint colors. Get it together! Why cant you make touch up paint of YOUR OWN PAINT?!?!?!
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Torres

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Damaged/Box was perfect
customer_reviews.text: This arrived damaged with a leak. Nothing was wrong with the box so I have to believe it was shipped out this way. I tried to return it but was refused so I will get a different can and eat the cost. I have to much time in prep to risk that the product is ok. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: The silver metallic is not great quality. I have used in on several project and it’s fine to use on table legs etc. Doing some bike frames and having used urethane car paint you can’t compare. I suggest a 2k clear coat instead of using duplicate color. Finally if you do a tank or helmet I think you should spend the extra money and go to a car paint shop.
customer_reviews.author: Per Kristiansson

customer_reviews.title: pretty good for pre mix
customer_reviews.text: Here's the colors I've used: emerald green, red, molten red, yellow, orange, and blue. Pretty vibrant colors emerald green was a little darker than what I would like. White i have also, nothing fancy just white. Caution for midnight blue (not pictured) it is more turquoise than blue. It takes a LOT of coats for it to get dark enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my track bike, but use better paint for anything else.
customer_reviews.text: In comparison to other paints. You're better off going with a higher quality paint. Especially if you're new and spraying through extremely cheap gear. (HF/Menards, etc) This stuff flows out in a weird way. Same with the clear. But overall, if your prep is good and your surface is smooth, with decent set up and technique you can get a passable result. Worked fine for my track bike, which only has to look good from 50ft at 50mph, but wouldnt want it anywhere near any of my other bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lanning

customer_reviews.title: Great paint for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good paint. A little more orange than I thought. But still a steal for the price. Not ideal for a newer car, but for someone looking to make a beater look shnazzy, this is the stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Nielson

customer_reviews.title: Great color and goes on good with a little reducer
customer_reviews.text: Great color and goes on good with a little reducer.Great results with dupli color products..just gotta know how to use them.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: its paint !!
customer_reviews.text: wasn't bad, it went on smooth. I used it for motorcycle smaller parts like battery box. I wouldn't use it on tank or anything to crazy but a good paint just to spray not so show kinda parts. price is great.
customer_reviews.author: JP Custom Switch Controls

customer_reviews.title: Its not Jet Black
customer_reviews.text: Laid on three coats of Jet Black and three coats of clear. Went on fine but when it got in the sun it wasn't anything close to black but a dirty dark dark brown. How could such a big auto paint name let something like this get on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Not bad! But not great!
customer_reviews.text: I painted my Firebird with this stuff. I required roughly 8 cans to get the job done (including wheel flares and spoiler). It's very thin and you'll need to do several coats to make it look good. For the price, I'd recommend the this product. If you're looking for a show car finish, not so much. There are higher quality products that come along with a higher price tag!
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: cheap paint
customer_reviews.text: cheap paint but don't let that stop you from buying great to learn how to paint candy colors my 2 sons enjoyed painting their guitars with it you need a base color and a clear coat to go with it
customer_reviews.author: deadbob

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Sealed
customer_reviews.text: The sealing was great on this product. I could have gotten a better local price and actually did for the remaining clear coat can's I purchased but this worked great and arrived in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Sco-Pi

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Absolute waste of money. The primer right out of the can was separated no matter how much I shook or stirred it, it wood not mix. Was chucky and kept clogging gun. Maybe to old or expired. As I sprayed it on new metal ruffed up. It just dripped and ran away. Total waste of time and money. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great paint but learn how to ship it
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome paint to use for someone that does not have a lot of experience painting. Goes on good with a beautiful finish. But they need to learn how to box it up when it’s shipped. All 6 of 6 cans are dented or smashed in!
customer_reviews.author: BY

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE COLOR ON THE CAN
customer_reviews.text: tHIS IS A DINGY DARKER GREEN COLOR; NO WHERE NEAR THE BRIGHT SAFETY GREEN IT LOOKS LIKE ON THE CAN. STUCK WITH 2 CANS; NO RETURNS. WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME.
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: Very super white
customer_reviews.text: I painted my wheels with this championship white! Turned out amazing! Get a lot of compliments
customer_reviews.author: D-block

customer_reviews.title: Take your time  do it right or don't do it at all
customer_reviews.text: All these dupli-colors go on great. You need to know your timing between coats. All depends on temp and thickness of paint you lay on. If you stick to the right way of laying it down you will have a great finish .
customer_reviews.author: TIMOTHY W.

customer_reviews.title: not chemical resistant
customer_reviews.text: applies nice and easy to polish. a lo ready thinned out so easy to prep. HOWEVER THIS IS NOT CHEMICAL RESISTANT. GAS WILL MAKE IT PEEL.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Udell

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful color but not for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: Look up a video of how to use a paint gun. It will help you so much. Go slow and in my case learn how to wet sand properly. (picture is with clear coat unfinished)
customer_reviews.author: Jake Weber

customer_reviews.title: Horrible primer
customer_reviews.text: Product sprays horrible. Both cans I ordered came with large clumps in the bottom of the can. Not sure if the paint was just really old or it’s just garbage paint but I will definitely never buy again
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: The Jet Black Paint is GRAY!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Jet Black Paint and Clear looked OK before drying, but after a day of drying it is gray. What a waste of time and effort!!! And now Amazon won't even give me a credit??!! You get what you pay for; thought I could save a few bucks, but it will now end up costing me $100s.
customer_reviews.author: B Stine

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: If you are trying to make your old car looks better and want to paint it for less then $100 bucks... how ahead. I did it in less then 2 hours + preparation. I think the results depends of your experience (I don't have it, so the job looks just ok)
customer_reviews.author: Jaime d.

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Great product really. I have dipped a few aftermarket Mercedes emblems in this to keep the paint nice, and it seems to be doing the job quite well
customer_reviews.author: Sharon S

customer_reviews.title: dupli-color does a very poor job explaining how to get the correct look they ...
customer_reviews.text: dupli-color does a very poor job explaining how to get the correct look they advertise on there chrome yellow paint.In fact all of there paint shop line of paints i believe are falsely advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Roads

customer_reviews.title: Good lacquer paint.
customer_reviews.text: Great paint. Please wrap it more for shipping. This can almost opened during shipping. Huge problem.
customer_reviews.author: J D L

customer_reviews.title: Clear is Better
customer_reviews.text: Came well sealed with clips and double wrapped. Looking forward to using this on all my painting projects.
customer_reviews.author: V Utx

customer_reviews.title: Good but awful packaging
customer_reviews.text: Would be nice if they came wrapped up like the clear coat did one can of paint leaked all over the box and my steps but other then that good product just need to pay attention to the packaging
customer_reviews.author: ted contois

customer_reviews.title: Green and gorgeous
customer_reviews.text: Already mixed and ready to spray, I'm not a professional but I still had professional results.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Nice color
customer_reviews.text: Don't hate me I don't use airbrush,to Use this is thin paint good for that.i liked it was easy to throw on canvas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A-OKAY!
customer_reviews.text: I am quite pleased with this item! I would gladly recommend this seller & product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Parlous1

customer_reviews.title: Safety to paint.
customer_reviews.text: It was just what I wanted the jet black . I used it on the truck bumper. Thank you for my merchandise!🤠👍🏿🙏🏿
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dexter

customer_reviews.title: shoots nice
customer_reviews.text: came as advertised needs to come down on price a little but pretty happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: No real shine
customer_reviews.text: Must use a couple of clear coats afterwards. Average price everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Tammi Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Pretty thin, but easy to spray.
customer_reviews.text: I was used to single-stage paint and this is VERY thin: careful when you pour it out of the can because it will splash very easily. The coverage is all right, I’m not a pro, but I liked the result. I used an activated two-part clear coat and the finish looks pretty consistent. Will use again
customer_reviews.author: Designer & User

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This paint is practically amazing. Easy to use, looks great, and shines even before the clear coat. For being an inexperienced painter, and not wanting to mess with the whole mixing process, this is perfect and looks professional. My 300zx is looking awesome
customer_reviews.author: Susan Cargile

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap paint
customer_reviews.text: Good paint, not really ready to spray...needs thinner. Good for base coat
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Dupli-Color BSB303 Candy Apple Red Paint
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't the Candy Apple Red I wanted. Was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Yoshizawa

customer_reviews.title: Lighter shade of red
customer_reviews.text: Awesome color but not for my truck. I want a deep red close to a burgundy this is a lite red close to Burt orange.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Evans

customer_reviews.title: sprayed nice
customer_reviews.text: it probably would have been better if I had a better gun than a leaky harbor freight gun
customer_reviews.author: todd johnston

customer_reviews.title: Come on delivery people
customer_reviews.text: Ok stuff to sell a car quick, all was good but the delivery was horrible, cans where bent and some clear cane out, good thing these were just extra
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use reasonable priced and nice color.
customer_reviews.text: This paint system was easy to use and cost me a quarter of a paint supply chain price. This is my 1st paint job I needed something reasonable priced and easy to use. I used it to practice my paint technique. I really like the results. I think the color is really nice. Planning to paint my project car this color.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never painted before, went to Harbin freight bought a cheap 10.00 sprayer and I used the primer, metallic blue, and clear. It took a minute for me to get the hang of the sprayer but I liked how it came out. Easy to use and I’ll buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Looks good too.
customer_reviews.text: can't get any easier to apply than this. Looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: John Clark

customer_reviews.title: car
customer_reviews.text: Buy it and get my car. Not bad. Not broken
customer_reviews.author: dan dan zhang

customer_reviews.title: Primer
customer_reviews.text: I guess that I didn't read all of the listing, that is quite a bit of money to pay for something that is already mixed and ready to go, I wanted to buy primer......I will mix it myself
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bell

customer_reviews.title: Product quality
customer_reviews.text: Not glossy. Even after wet sanding and rubbing compound. I've been doing paint work for over 50 years. Never had this problem .
customer_reviews.author: attilio presciutti

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY UNLESS YOU PLAN ON BUYING ALOT OF CANS TO PAINT ONE BUMPER
customer_reviews.text: I have been painting cars for years. I hear about duplicator an tried it out on a couple of parts I needed to paint. The primer is just horrible it does not come out the gun well it sprays in little dots an not like most paints out their! The only great thing about it is that it dries quick
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Used as clear over custom graffiti on my adventure trailer
customer_reviews.text: Went on well, seems to like a little higher pressure than normal. Atomizes well. Shot using a HF paint gun, and a basic dryer/filter.
customer_reviews.author: MaksV

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Used it on a guitar refinish .... gave it three low pressure coats...PERFECT results. Came out exactly the way I wanted and imagined.
customer_reviews.author: Magoo

customer_reviews.title: Not show car paint but good for you daily or budget build.
customer_reviews.text: I like this color. Paint looks to be good low priced alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product for professionals
customer_reviews.text: Not for beginners. Do not thin the product. Looks great on the car.
customer_reviews.author: D T S

customer_reviews.title: Proper prep and proper set up and you will be fine
customer_reviews.text: Had no issues spraying this paint. Set your gun up correctly and don’t stand so close while spraying. Also make sure you do proper prep before hand
customer_reviews.author: Tyler S.

customer_reviews.title: Managed to find this gem after the auto parts stores ...
customer_reviews.text: Managed to find this gem after the auto parts stores stopped selling it. This paint seems to be newer than the the stuff the auto parts stores sell.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Takes 6+ quarts to cover vehichle
customer_reviews.text: I thought the color was off when I opened the can. The color appears green but the next day it looks like the Midnight Blue color. Product is VERY thin. I will be buying paint mixed at local parts store due to MUCH LOWER costs to cover vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Soyews

customer_reviews.title: The paint comes clumpy
customer_reviews.text: This paint comes with clumps of what looks like cottage cheese at the bottom. Even after shaking and stirring the paint, it has a bunch of clumps at the bottom. You must use a strainer. The strainer picks up most of it, but it clogged up my paint gun numerous times anyway
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: comes pre-mixed ready to spray lacquer primer. i sprayed ...
customer_reviews.text: comes pre-mixed ready to spray lacquer primer. i sprayed at 90 degrees and 90% humidity. It didnt get rocky on me. i did wet sand the slight orange peel..It could have been my 1.6mm tip doing it....
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: U get what u pay for, next time I'm buying House of Color candy apple. Sounded to good to be true!
customer_reviews.text: The candy color was not candy at all, as soon as I applied it to the base and metalic clear it covered everything underneath like regular red paint. Terible candy apple substitute. Did not work like tru candy! Don't waste ur money like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok for smaller projects
customer_reviews.text: Does not spray well leaves a grainy texture,drys quickly sprays better if thinned
customer_reviews.author: JEFF WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Damaged!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one quart of the Duplicolor Blue metallic and one quart of clear coat.. Both cans were smashed to the point we're paint started to come out the sides... I should have gotten a discount but of course that's not how they work... Not happy that I payed full price for damaged goods...
customer_reviews.author: Motorcycle Dude

customer_reviews.title: Ok paint
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to spray and it's true you must clear it if you don't the paint will come off in your hand
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: easy to have run
customer_reviews.text: ti thin of paint. Hard to work with. Ran out twice and still didn't finish the car, easy to have run.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Melchor

customer_reviews.title: 2- 1 qt. cans come in the box. ...
customer_reviews.text: 2- 1 qt. cans come in the box. pre-mixed clear .The more coats I put on the deeper, and shinier it got. no problems if you know how to spray it. I could have wet sanded between coats for a deeper shine, but i was just spraying a Berger panel.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: Expensive for how much you need to use.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, its expensive primer, two cans was enough to cover my mustang. Expensive for how much you need to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR AUTOMOBILE USE
customer_reviews.text: Avoid if you plan to use this clear for automobile painting. Do NOT use!
customer_reviews.author: James Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not good for big projects
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, takes a lot of product to cover vehicle. Ok for small projects, do not use to paint a whole vehicle
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Paint!
customer_reviews.text: Good product!! Just what a needed as an alternative to rustoleum's discontinued color. Duplicolor saved the day!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality auto paint
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional painter but I have painted multiple cars and done several body work projects. This was some of the hardest paint I’ve ever used. Runs like crazy (super thin) and covers way less than real auto paint. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Asa

customer_reviews.title: seems to be good, lays down good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for clearing a guitar body, seems to be good, lays down good. have yet to wet sand and buff.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: good on smooth with little or no mixing. requires a little sanding for smooth finish
customer_reviews.author: roy martin

customer_reviews.title: Was skeptical at first but this paint really pulled off ...
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical at first but this paint really pulled off. No need to mix with anything just load and spray. Even sprayed my headlights with some clear & they came out looking brand new
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Would not Recommend or Buy Again - Cheap LAcquer
customer_reviews.text: This is a Cheap Lacquer Clear Coat - The Finish Was Dull - Buy a Urethane Clear coat and save time and Hassle
customer_reviews.author: jason butler

customer_reviews.title: Read label need conventional gun!
customer_reviews.text: The dont tell you that you need a conventional spray gun. Cant use your HVLP. Called customer service and they confirmed that. Spent $129 on new gun!
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT SOLOMON

customer_reviews.title: sands easily, but as a thinner lacquer based system
customer_reviews.text: See my other review on the Jet Black for this system. Quality paint, sands easily, but as a thinner lacquer based system, be prepared and order extra, especially if you know you're going to make mistakes. Buying in bulk is worth it as well. One star off on the price. It's a little steep for a quart of this but I'm sure more advanced systems cost far more.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob N. Smits

customer_reviews.title: Leaked in shipping
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a single quart for a small job. They use clips to secure the lid, some of which were missing, so the paint leaked and only half a quart was left in the can. Otherwise, I think the product itself will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stray away from buying from these guys
customer_reviews.text: Recieved cans beat the heck out of them, looks as if they knew since they added closures to the tops to not have them open
customer_reviews.author: Tokyo_Hippie

customer_reviews.title: Not Midnight Blue
customer_reviews.text: Order the BSP210 Midnight Blue and turned out to be emerald green not Midnight blue
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gautreaux

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: instead of calling it jet black,you need to call it dark gray. Does not look like the black on my mustang.😕
customer_reviews.author: Lori Liff

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: im sorry but this stuff was garbage I paint cars motorcycles etc.and I was trying to save a lil money and use it for a mid coat for some candy pearl green and it messed up my paint job
customer_reviews.author: David mcgrew

customer_reviews.title: Great Paint
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered came severely damaged so after contacting Amazon, they sent a replacement with no extra charge. This paint was admired by my co-workers and fortunately for my car, I only need 1 quart.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond E. Sears

customer_reviews.title: Just a dent in can
customer_reviews.text: Can was dented up but not to bad....maybe they should have added more padding with it
customer_reviews.author: jaime kavanagh

customer_reviews.title: ... and the shine after the gloss clear application was awesome!! Yes it's old school technowledgy
customer_reviews.text: If you know how to paint it's not a problem and the shine after the gloss clear application was awesome!! Yes it's old school technowledgy, however it worked and looks excellent. I received an award at an air-cooled event in Tucson just a couple of months after repainting!
customer_reviews.author: S. DAHL

customer_reviews.title: It's watery but it works perfect
customer_reviews.text: This candy paint is awesome a lot of people say that the pain is not worth it but it is worth it is that a lot of people does not know how to use it but it does work amazing I recommended 100%
customer_reviews.author: Angie Perez

customer_reviews.title: Dupli-Color provides a good quality product for both the novice auto painter and ...
customer_reviews.text: Dupli-Color provides a good quality product for both the novice auto painter and a cheap alternative for the advanced autobody mechanic as well.
customer_reviews.author: David Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Good Color
customer_reviews.text: this paint is really good for the price. just make sure that you put some primer before adding the paint. if you don't, the paint will start peeling off once its been there for a while and the sun breaks it. also, make sure you put some kind of clear after cause when you wash your car the water spots stick to it. i used it on some car grills and rims and the color looks really good and gives it that customize look. i really liked the paint and for the price it was really good. i added thinner so a 32 oz can will last a while depending on what your painting.
customer_reviews.author: SKYWALKER

product_meta.title: Dupli-Color EBSP30000 Clear Coat Paint Shop Finish System - 32 oz., Clear Gloss
product_meta.description: Color:Clear| Size:single| Style:Step 3 / Step 4 CandyDupliColor's Paint Shop Finish system allows you to create a high-quality finish when using the primer, color and clear. It's a high-quality lacquer system designed for automotive and motorcycle applications. Paint Shop is easy to apply, dries quickly and can be buffed to a brilliant smooth finish. It's a ready to spray system, so no mixing or reducing is required. With no re-coat window, additional coats can be applied at any time
feature_bullets: Easy to apply and dries quickly
No recoat window, reapply at any time
Ideal for automotive exterior body projects
